definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

sentences.english: Of course it is, as it is the signal flag of misery.
sentences.chinese: 当然是的，因为那是痛苦的信号旗。

sentences.english: Seeing a ship on the horizon, we ran up a flag of distress.
sentences.chinese: 看到地平线上出现一只船，我们连忙升起遇险信号旗。

sentences.english: The man was waving a flag at the railway crossing.
sentences.chinese: 那人在铁路交叉处挥动一面信号旗。

sentences.english: The signal flags hanging on the front of The Krusty Krab do not spell a word.
sentences.chinese: 蟹堡王前面挂着的信号旗拼不出一个完整的单词。

sentences.english: Party B should hang up the signal flags or lamps during poisonous fumigation.
sentences.chinese: 乙方在熏蒸期间，应全程悬挂信号旗或信号灯。

sentences.english: Like the title says, new maps and signal flags.
sentences.chinese: 正如题目中所写，这个版本带来新地图和新信号旗。

sentences.english: Please hoist up a flag "I require a tug".
sentences.chinese: 请挂上一面“我需要一艘拖轮”的信号旗。

sentences.english: The signal flag is fully in our sight from this position.
sentences.chinese: 我从这个位置完全可以看到信号旗。

definition: emperor's or general's banner erected on an ivory-tipped pole at a military camp or headquarters (in ancient times)
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
flag signals (for communicating between ships or army units)/semaphore
to beat a gong/to sound the retreat
